Summary: Arch of lights on the western horizon.
divs: Sighting DetailsAshburn, Virginia 8:50-9:00pm Monday, May 9th 2011 I was leaving work at around 8:50pm and noticed a group of people out in the employee parking lot. I walked over to them and one of them told me to look in the sky to the west. I looked and was amazed to see a arch of lights in the sky, obviously flying crafts of some kind. I first thought they were planes, being that Dulles Airport is about 8 miles away. I asked if anyone had a video camera or phone, as mine was out of batteries. There were 2 short videos shot, one of them is attached, the other I am waiting to get from someone else that was there. The person that took this video had already been watching the lights for 10 minutes before I arrived, with no change in formation, just remaining a steady arch in the sky. I stayed for another 3-4 minutes watching in awe and then the arch broke into 2 seperate small bundled formations with a bright light seperating the two. The lights were white and the center light appeared to be changing colors from redish to white. I watched this for about 5 more minutes and got into my car to go home. One thing that I did notice was that there was NO air traffic in the sky. While driving home, I could see the lights in my rear view mirror. By that time there were only 2 visible and they dimmed away. I have no idea what we saw, if the military was doing training or if they were helicoptors in a formation. All I know is that it was really odd and after being in the Marines for 5 years, I have never seen anything like it.
